content.question: In a region of space, the electric potential <math alttext="V sub x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of position <math alttext="x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> along an <math alttext="x axis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mtext>-axis</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by the equation <math alttext="V sub x equals R x minus S x squared " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>R</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>âˆ’</mo><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="R equals 3.0 the fraction volts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3.0</mn><mfrac><mrow><mtext>v</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S equals 8.0 the fraction volts per meter squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8.0</mn><mfrac><mrow><mtext>v</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. At what point on the <math alttext="x axis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mtext>-axis</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is the magnitude of the electric field equal to zero?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
